class pydexpi.syndata.pattern.BasicPipingInConnector(label, reference_object, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Connector

Extends the Connector for a basic piping in connection

connect_to_counterpart(counterpart: BasicPipingOutConnector)[source]

The method invokes a connection between the connection and its counterpart. The implementation to this is subclass specific.

Parameters:

counterpart ((subclass specific type)) – The other connector that is to be connected to.

Returns:

This method only performs the connection in the pattern and deletes the connector object and its counterpart.

Return type:

None

class pydexpi.syndata.pattern.Connector(label: str, reference_object: CustomAttributeOwner, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: ABC

Pattern instances contain connectors. These contain information and logic on the connector that can be accessed by the generator to base its decision on connection on.

referenced_types

Abstract, static attribute. A tuple of types that may be referenced by this object

Type:

tuple of types

label

The label of the connector

Type:

str

kwinfos

A dictionary that contains relevant infos which can be retrieved by keyword. The contents can be dynamically manipulated during generation.

Type:

dict

add_dexpi_label()[source]

Adds a label in the form of a custom attribute to the referenced object, so that it can be recovered after serialization.

abstract connect_to_counterpart(counterpart)[source]

The method invokes a connection between the connection and its counterpart. The implementation to this is subclass specific.

Parameters:

counterpart ((subclass specific type)) – The other connector that is to be connected to.

Returns:

This method only performs the connection in the pattern and deletes the connector object and its counterpart.

Return type:

None

classmethod get_dexpi_custom_attribute_label()[source]

Get the name of the attribute label associated to each of the connector subclasses, as used to store the reference in dexpi.

get_information()[source]
classmethod import_from_valid_reference_object(reference_object: CustomAttributeOwner)[source]

Create an instance from a valid reference object.

This class method attempts to create an instance of the class by searching for an associated custom attribute within the provided reference object. If no appropriate label is not found, a ValueError is raised.

Parameters:

reference_object (CustomAttributeOwner) – An object that contains custom attributes.

Returns:

An instance of the class initialized with the value of the found custom attribute and the reference object.

Return type:

instance of cls

Raises:

ValueError – If no appropriate label is not found.

abstract property referencable_types

Tuple of classes that are valid to be referenced. This static attribute is subclass-specific.

remove_dexpi_label()[source]

Removes the custom attribute labels used for serialization from the referenced object to avoid artefacts in exporting patterns.

class pydexpi.syndata.pattern.Pattern(name: str, model: DexpiModel, connectors: list[Connector])[source]

Bases: object

A pattern is a wrapper class for a DexpiModel for the generator. It describes a given P&ID state and contatins connector references as interfaces.

name

The name reference of the Pattern

Type:

str

model

The instance of the dexpi model wrapped by this pattern for the generator.

Type:

DexpiModel

connectors

The connectors associated to this pattern, defining its interfaces for connection by the generator.

Type:

list[Connectors]

connect_to_counterpart(own_connector: Connector, counterpart: Pattern, counterpart_connector: Connector) → Pattern[source]

This method connects this pattern to another pattern via the connectors specified.

Note that the contents of the counterpart pattern are imported into this pattern, instead of generating a new pattern (Notably, the contents of its dexpi model, such as meta data). That way, e.g. the current_pattern in a generator can be conserved rather than having to be replaced at every step.

Parameters:

  • own_connector (Connector) – The connector in this pattern (self) that should be used for connection to the counterpart.

  • counterpart (Pattern) – The counterpart that should be connected and incorporated to this. pattern.

  • counterpart_connector (Connector) – The connector in the counterpart pattern that should be used for connection to this pattern (self).

Returns:

A reference to self after connection is completed.

Return type:

Pattern

Raises:

ValueError – If either the own_connector or the connector of the counterpart are not associated to the corresponding patterns.

classmethod init_by_inferring_connectors(name: str, model: DexpiModel)[source]

This method acts as a second constructor in which the connectors are not passed explicitly, but are inferred by the labels in the dexpi model.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the pattern.

  • model (DexpiModel) – The model to be stored in the pattern.

Returns:

The newly generated pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

classmethod load_pattern(path_dir: Path, name: str, serializer: Serializer)[source]

Loads a pattern in the directory specified in path_dir with the name given in name.

Parameters:

  • path_dir (Path) – The directory the pattern is saved in.

  • name (str) – The name of the pattern.

  • serializer (Serializer) – The serializer to be used for loading.

Returns:

The loaded pattern.

Return type:

Pattern

save_pattern(path_dir: Path, serializer: Serializer)[source]

Saves a pattern to a directory in dirpath with the file name taken from its name attribute. For this, it uses the dexpi serializer specified in serializer.

Parameters:

  • path_dir (Path) – The path of the directory the pattern is stored in

  • serializer (Serializer) – The serializer object to be used for saving
